medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive postnatal craniosynostosis and increased intracranial pressure.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patients initially present with normal skull shape and open sutures at birth but develop multiple-suture craniosynostosis postnatally. Symptoms include headaches, vomiting, irritability, visual disturbances, papilledema, thumbprinting of the skull, and anterior fontanelle bulge. Symptoms progress over time, often leading to severe consequences if not monitored.
medical_history.family_history: A strong family history of craniosynostosis was noted in some cases, including multiple family members exhibiting similar midface Crouzon syndrome features.
